Posts.Content: Replicant: I fervently hoped you were right and I was wrong, but unfortunately asp's publication of the clarified data table sort of settles that. His fPSA/PSA appears to be 6%, calculated as fPSA divided by total PSA, and rounded down to the nearest integer. Even discounting the fPSA/PSA completely, there is still very high total PSA for age, and disturbing PSA velocity from January 2008. In the circumstances, I stand by my original view that asp should travel immediately to a consultation with a top class urologist.
Posts.Signature: Skippy (Australia): age at dx 53, PSA 6.0, biopsy, dx Aug 2007: T2aNxMx Gleason 7 (3+4); open RRP + PLND 01Nov2007, both bundles spared, pathology pT2aN0Mx, Gl.7 (3+4), margins negative, no perineural involvement, lymph nodes clean. PSA since surgery undetectable (below 0.04). Continence back to 100% of pre-op state within 2 mths of surgery; erection initially nil, 30% at 12 months, 50% at 26 months with regular tadalafil + sildenafil before practical attempts.
Posts.Title: PSA 9.8 at age 30, advice needed

Posts.Content: asp, If you are in Brunei, then I think a quick holiday in Australia combined with a visit at the St. Vincent's Prostate Cancer Centre, St. Vincent's Clinic, Sydney, is definitely in order, and a consultation with the head of that establishment, Professor Phillip Stricker, a prostate specialist of world renown. It might be that there is simply not a sufficient level of knowledge in the comparatively small Bruneian health system to diagnose and deal with rarer form of prostate cancer. If I were you, I'd contact St.Vincent by email without delay and ask their view on what should be done - they are quite approachable. Their web pages are at prostate.com.au
Posts.Signature: Skippy (Australia): age at dx 53, PSA 6.0, biopsy, dx Aug 2007: T2aNxMx Gleason 7 (3+4); open RRP + PLND 01Nov2007, both bundles spared, pathology pT2aN0Mx, Gl.7 (3+4), margins negative, no perineural involvement, lymph nodes clean. PSA since surgery undetectable (below 0.04). Continence back to 100% of pre-op state within 2 mths of surgery; erection initially nil, 30% at 12 months, 50% at 26 months with regular tadalafil + sildenafil before practical attempts.
Posts.Title: PSA 9.8 at age 30, advice needed

Posts.Content: I'd truly hate to be a bearer of bad news, but in my most humble opinion as someone who had his CaP detected early, I really think more determined diagnostic effort, and an eminent expert opinion, are definitely called for. Andrology Australia posts on their prostate pages the PSA levels for different age groups of Western men. The three numbers in every line are: Age (years) | Average PSA | Upper limit of normal PSA 40-49 | 0.65 | 2.0 50-59 | 0.85 | 3.0 60-69 | 1.39 | 4.0 70-79 | 1.64 | 5 .5 As you can see, your baseline (3.0) at age 22 was nearly five-fold of an average, and 150% of an alert level for a 40yo. man. Currently your PSA of 9.8 is at nearly five times the alert level of PSA for a man in his forties. It is likely is a significant problem somewhere, and it must be found. You have a very high baseline PSA to begin with, and a rapid PSA increase which does not respond to antibiotics. If I were you, I'd be looking for an opinion from an eminent prostate cancer specialist at a centre of excellence in urological cancers (John Hopkins, Sloan-Kettering and a few others). You might perhaps benefit from a TRUS examination with the color Doppler option, which can pick up deep seated transitional zone tumours which are very difficult to find in biopsies. There exist rare variants of prostate cancer which strike early in life. It is in your interest to get to the bottom of the question of your rising PSA as soon as practicable.
Posts.Signature: Skippy (Australia): age at dx 53, PSA 6.0, biopsy, dx Aug 2007: T2aNxMx Gleason 7 (3+4); open RRP + PLND 01Nov2007, both bundles spared, pathology pT2aN0Mx, Gl.7 (3+4), margins negative, no perineural involvement, lymph nodes clean. PSA since surgery undetectable (below 0.04). Continence back to 100% of pre-op state within 2 mths of surgery; erection initially nil, 30% at 12 months, 50% at 26 months with regular tadalafil + sildenafil before practical attempts.

Posts.Content: asp: If your fPSA/PSAis at about 6.3% now and was about 7.4% in 2008, as the quoted data suggest, then your situation is dangerous, and must be acted on without further delay. fPSA/PSA below 10% means that you likely have prostate cancer. The lower the percentage the greater the probability of the cancer. You have alarming total PSA, alarming fPSA/PSA, and alarming PSA increase rate. You need a world class urologist and a full suite of diagnostics immediately. Stop waiting and travel to Sydney (your closest prostate cancer centre of excellence) NOW.
Posts.Signature: Skippy (Australia): age at dx 53, PSA 6.0, biopsy, dx Aug 2007: T2aNxMx Gleason 7 (3+4); open RRP + PLND 01Nov2007, both bundles spared, pathology pT2aN0Mx, Gl.7 (3+4), margins negative, no perineural involvement, lymph nodes clean.
